contextId.information: This is an idiom that means Yahweh spoke. "Yahweh spoke his message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is a common expression for traveling to distant places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"ran away from Yahweh." "got up" is referring to Jonah leaving where he was. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: got up to run away from the presence of Yahweh

contextId.information: "Pray to your god!" "Call" refers to getting the attention of someone. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom that means Yahweh spoke. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jon:01:01|1:1]]. AT: "Yahweh spoke his message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to leaving the place one is at. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"So Jonah left the beach." "got up" refers to leaving the place Jonah was at. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"a city of three days' journey." A person had to walk for three days to completely go through it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
